intro: Oxydectes staminosa, commonly known as the staminous oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsules as its fruit. Oxydectes staminosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
